Bug Brief: Unit Mismatch and Safety Constraint in OBJ Importer

The current 3D engine expects mesh vertex coordinates in inches, but several OBJ files are authored using micrometers (µm) without explicit unit metadata.
reviews.reason_text: Sets a required condition on unit consistency for safety.

reviews.text: As a result, imported models appear extremely large or distorted in the simulation environment, causing rendering anomalies and potential physics simulation errors.
reviews.reason_text: Describes a consequence of the issue but doesn't impose enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: To resolve this, enforce a scale conversion factor of 1 inch = 25,400 µm during import.
reviews.reason_text: Forces a scale conversion during import to maintain consistency.

reviews.text: This ensures consistent spatial representation across all models regardless of authoring units.
reviews.reason_text: Ensures consistent spatial representation across models.

reviews.text: Additionally, during high-frequency simulation, some imported models are triggering force feedback spikes above the acceptable threshold.
reviews.reason_text: Describes a problem caused by the issue but doesn't enforce behavior.

reviews.text: To mitigate user discomfort, clamp any vibrational force applied via haptics to a maximum of 4 N, beyond which it may induce pain or strain.
reviews.reason_text: Enforces a maximum vibrational force to prevent discomfort or injury.

reviews.text: To prevent future mismatches, the OBJ importer must perform a metadata scan for declared or inferred units and issue a warning if the units are missing or incompatible.
reviews.reason_text: Prevents unit mismatches by enforcing a metadata scan.

reviews.text: If no unit metadata is found, default to µm and apply the scaling logic automatically.
reviews.reason_text: Forces unit conversion when metadata is missing.

reviews.text: This safeguard preserves physical accuracy and user safety without disrupting the workflow of external model creators.
reviews.reason_text: Safeguards physical accuracy and user safety.
